intro: Symplocos occulta, commonly known as the hidden evergreen, is a small shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features oval, glossy leaves that are typically dark green and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
